page.title: 20Upperton Farm.
page.content: This farm occupies about 4 sq.km.of flat open land in the heart of Eastbourne. It is surrounded on 3 sides by houses and factories. The low lying clay & loam soils are subject to flooding so the farm is mostly pasture and rough grazing. The tenant farmer with 2 employees manages a herd of 1200 Suffolk and Dorset Down Sheep and about 120 cattle including Friesians and Charolais. The farmer has improved the land by draining and natural manuring and is anxious to preserve rare wild flowers and grasses. Soon the farm may disappear because of Eastbourne's new park scheme. { {Compiled by pupils at Bourne C.P. & {St.Thomas a Beckett R.C.Schools under {the direction of Mr.S.P.Salmon {(Bourne) & Mr.K.Walsh (St.Thomas).}
